lines.speaker: Callum
lines.text: There you are. Come in, come in — careful of the stack by the door.

lines.speaker: Callum
lines.text: This passage describes a talent the Dissolved called 'Mnemonic Architecture.'

lines.speaker: Callum
lines.text: You're a Mnemonic Architect, and we just didn't have a word for it until now.

lines.speaker: Callum
lines.text: A traveler came through last month — a woman named Lira. She recognized it in you immediately.

lines.speaker: Callum
lines.text: This is a memory fragment. My first lesson. It's a joyful memory. I'd like you to have it.

lines.speaker: Callum
lines.text: Now go find Lira. Her workshop is south of the square.

lines.speaker: Callum
lines.text: I heard. Lira...

lines.speaker: Callum
lines.text: She's alive. The crystal doesn't kill.

lines.speaker: Callum
lines.text: You'll need to go north. Into the Frontier — where the dormant gods sleep.

lines.speaker: Callum
lines.text: The mountain pass north of here — it's been closed for as long as I can remember. But I don't think anything's stopping you anymore.

trigger: Callum joins party at Ridgewalker Camp (Scene 2)

lines.speaker: Callum
lines.text: I'm too old to stay behind and too curious to let you go alone.

lines.speaker: Callum
lines.text: I won't be much use in a fight — my knees aren't what they were. But I know things about the Dissolved that might save your life.

lines.speaker: Callum
lines.text: Lead on. I'll try to keep up.

lines.speaker: Callum
lines.text: Forty years of study. And now I'm watching one wake up.

lines.speaker: Callum
lines.text: I thought I'd cry. I'm not crying. I'm too amazed to cry.

lines.speaker: Callum
lines.text: Not walked away. Chose not to finish. The Dissolved trusted that future generations would complete it.

lines.speaker: Callum
lines.text: Broadcasting here is different. You're painting reality into existence.

lines.speaker: Callum
lines.text: No. This is where the world is still beginning.

lines.speaker: Callum
lines.text: If the Curator succeeds... these lines stop. The drawing ends mid-stroke.

lines.speaker: Callum
lines.text: The Preserver Fortress. Three floors of crystallized perfection.

lines.speaker: Callum
lines.text: The First Memory is on the lowest floor. We need to go through the Fortress to reach it.

lines.speaker: Callum
lines.text: The god recall fractures — look.

lines.speaker: Callum
lines.text: The gods are here. Their influence has been eroding this crystal since the moment you recalled them.

lines.speaker: Callum
lines.text: This one... this one is hard.

lines.speaker: Callum
lines.text: That child learned to walk. And the Curator froze it because it was the most perfect moment.

lines.speaker: Callum
lines.text: Perfect moments aren't meant to last. They're meant to lead somewhere.

lines.speaker: Callum
lines.text: You want to silence the question. But the question IS the world.

lines.speaker: Callum
lines.text: The question changed. It's not 'Why do things change?' anymore.

lines.speaker: Callum
lines.text: The world has grown beyond that question. It needs a new one.

lines.speaker: Callum
lines.text: Forty years I spent studying the Dissolved.

lines.speaker: Callum
lines.text: They let go because they were done. Their work was complete.

lines.speaker: Callum
lines.text: I'm proud of you. Lira and I both are.

lines.speaker: Callum
lines.text: Of course it is. The new question is 'What will we create next?' That's a question with infinite answers.
